definition: Serve the People!, CCP political slogan
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
Lei Feng (1940-1962), made into a model of altruism and dedication to the Party by propaganda from 1963 onwards
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to report only the good news, not the bad news/to hold back unpleasant news/to sweep bad news under the carpet
to love Hong Kong (usually implying that one also supports the PRC government)
